title: Amid opt-out rumors, Sam Kennedy says Alex Bregman ‘wants to be here’ with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy affirms Alex Bregman's desire to stay with the Red Sox amid contract opt-out rumors.
Bregman, signed for $120 million, can opt out of his Red Sox contract after the 2025 season.
Despite rumors, Bregman emphasizes focusing on the current season and has delayed contract talks until the offseason.

title: Bill Belichick says in new book that Tom Brady made ‘right decision’ to leave Patriots in 2020
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick says Tom Brady made the 'right decision' to leave the Patriots in 2020 for a stronger team.
Brady joined Tampa Bay Buccaneers, won a Super Bowl, and excelled with 108 touchdowns over three seasons.
Belichick criticized for Patriots' poor drafting and lack of a Brady succession plan, ending with 2024 firing.

title: West Boylston town administrator fired after Trump flag dispute sues town
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Ryan, former West Boylston town administrator, sues town for more than $1.3 million after being fired over a Trump flag dispute.
Ryan's lawsuit claims wrongful termination due to his enforcement of town bylaws against political signage on public buildings.
Police Chief Dennis Minnich allegedly refused to work until Ryan was dismissed, citing a security violation over photo evidence.

title: 18-year-old injured in R.I. after lighting himself on fire for TikTok challenge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An 18-year-old in North Smithfield, R.I., was severely burned attempting a TikTok challenge involving fire on Sept. 6.
The challenge included pouring gasoline on themselves and jumping off a railroad trestle into Slatersville Reservoir, said Fire Chief Chartier.
The man suffered second- and third-degree burns and was hospitalized; his 16-year-old companion was uninjured.

title: ‘Fear and uncertainty’: Everett officials cancel Hispanic Heritage Month festival amid ICE crackdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Everett officials canceled the Fiesta Del Rio festival due to recent ICE raids causing community fear.
The Hispanic Heritage Month event was set for Sept. 20 in Rivergreen Park, emphasizing local culture and businesses.
Mayor Carlo DeMaria cited safety concerns, stating it would be inappropriate to hold the festival amid unrest.

title: Josh Kraft ends mayoral campaign after coming in second by nearly 50 points in Tuesday’s preliminary
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Josh Kraft ends his mayoral campaign after losing to Michelle Wu by nearly 50 points in the preliminary election.
Kraft, a philanthropist without prior public office, began his campaign in February aiming to address housing and homelessness issues.
Kraft plans to donate $3 million to local organizations for humanitarian efforts after ending his campaign.

title: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye: ‘He’s the right guy’ for Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Josh McDaniels defends Patriots QB Drake Maye, emphasizing a long-term vision for his development and success.
Drake Maye struggled in Week 1 against the Raiders, showing promise in the first half but faltering after an interception.
Patriots plan to support Maye by balancing their offense in Week 2, reducing pressure with a stronger running game.

title: Authorities in a Connecticut town want to speak with whoever is painting the squirrels
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Two squirrels painted red and blue found near Naubuc Avenue and High Street in East Hartford, Connecticut.
East Hartford Animal Control is collaborating with a wildlife rehabilitator to assess and aid the painted squirrels.
Authorities request public help in identifying those responsible; contact Animal Control at 860-291-7572.

title: 2 Mass. teachers reportedly on leave for reactions to Charlie Kirk’s death
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Two Massachusetts teachers are on leave after reacting to conservative activist Charlie Kirk's shooting death on social media.
Wachusett Regional School District and Framingham Public Schools cited inappropriate conduct as the reason for placing teachers on leave.
Police presence was increased in both districts, although no credible threats of violence were reported at the schools.

title: A top return from Bruins’ roster teardown, prospect Fraser Minten is looking to stick in NHL
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten, acquired in a trade with Toronto, is vying for a Boston Bruins roster spot this season.
Boston traded key players like Brad Marchand and Brandon Carlo to focus on future prospects and draft picks.
Minten is praised for his maturity and versatile skillset, playing 25 NHL games despite his young age.
